page.title: 18Morchard Bishop's Industry-1
page.content: The{Blacksmith}-Until about 30 years ago there were 2 blacksmiths in the village,now only 1 remains worked by 2 brothers who are now the fourth generation.In Victorian times it was all forge work,horse shoeing,making and repairing horse-drawn farm implements as well as making the iron-work and re-bonding wheels for carts and wagons.Now the work is mainly elecric and oxy-acetylene welding,repairing farm machinery and implements,making trailers etc..Forging ironwork using a coal fire and blower is still done but on a much smaller scale.The blacksmith is essential to the agricultural industry but will also make and repair domestic articles.
